hints.label: def-emergent-gravity
hints.title: Emergent Gravitational Potential
hints.content:
1867: :label: def-emergent-gravity
1868: 
1869: In the Fragile Gas, the **emergent gravitational potential** $\Phi(x)$ is defined by the relationship:
1870: 
1871: $$
1872: R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu = -\nabla^2 \Phi(x)
1873: $$
1874: 
1875: where $R_{\mu\nu}$ is the Ricci tensor and $\nabla^2$ is the Laplacian in the emergent metric $g_{ab}$. For the emergent metric $g_{ab} = H_{ab} + \varepsilon I_{ab}$, we have:
1876: 
1877: $$
1878: \Phi(x) \approx -\frac{1}{\varepsilon} f(x) + \text{const}
1879: $$

hints.label: def-geometric-phases
hints.title: Geometric Phase Classification
hints.content:
2001: :label: def-geometric-phases
2002: 
2003: At time $t$ and position $x$, the swarm is in one of three **geometric phases**:
2004: 
2005: 1. **Exploration phase**: $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu < 0$ (negative Ricci curvature along geodesics)
2006:    - Voronoi cells are **expanding** (on average)
2007:    - Walkers spread out, exploring new regions
2008:    - Analogous to **cosmological expansion** in general relativity
2009: 
2010: 2. **Exploitation phase**: $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu > 0$ (positive Ricci curvature along geodesics)
2011:    - Voronoi cells are **contracting** (on average)
2012:    - Walkers collapse toward fitness peaks
2013:    - Analogous to **gravitational collapse** in general relativity
2014: 
2015: 3. **Critical phase**: $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu = 0$ (zero Ricci curvature along geodesics)

hints.label: prop-thermal-control-phases
hints.title: Thermal Control of Phase Transitions
hints.content:
2029: :label: prop-thermal-control-phases
2030: 
2031: The regularization parameter $\varepsilon$ (thermal energy scale) controls the phase transition:
2032: 
2033: 1. **High temperature** ($\varepsilon \gg \|H\|$): $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu < 0$ → Exploration phase
2034: 2. **Low temperature** ($\varepsilon \ll \|H\|$): $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu > 0$ → Exploitation phase
2035: 3. **Critical temperature** ($\varepsilon \sim \|H\|$): $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu \approx 0$ → Phase transition

hints.label: def-shear-rotation-regimes
hints.title: Shear-Dominated and Rotation-Dominated Regimes
hints.content:
2057: :label: def-shear-rotation-regimes
2058: 
2059: At time $t$ and position $x$, define:
2060: 
2061: 1. **Shear parameter**: $\Sigma = \sqrt{\sigma_{\mu\nu}\sigma^{\mu\nu} / \theta^2}$
2062: 2. **Rotation parameter**: $\Omega = \sqrt{\omega_{\mu\nu}\omega^{\mu\nu} / \theta^2}$
2063: 
2064: The swarm dynamics are classified as:
2065: - **Shear-dominated**: $\Sigma \gg \Omega$ (anisotropic contraction/expansion)
hints.section: ## Section 4: Physical Interpretation and Phase Transitions
hints.raw_directive:
2054: The shear tensor $\sigma_{\mu\nu}$ and rotation tensor $\omega_{\mu\nu}$ encode fine geometric structures in the swarm dynamics.
2055: 
2056: :::{prf:definition} Shear-Dominated and Rotation-Dominated Regimes
2057: :label: def-shear-rotation-regimes
2058: 
2059: At time $t$ and position $x$, define:
2060: 
2061: 1. **Shear parameter**: $\Sigma = \sqrt{\sigma_{\mu\nu}\sigma^{\mu\nu} / \theta^2}$
2062: 2. **Rotation parameter**: $\Omega = \sqrt{\omega_{\mu\nu}\omega^{\mu\nu} / \theta^2}$
2063: 
2064: The swarm dynamics are classified as:
2065: - **Shear-dominated**: $\Sigma \gg \Omega$ (anisotropic contraction/expansion)
2066: - **Rotation-dominated**: $\Omega \gg \Sigma$ (vortex-like structures)

hints.label: thm-geometric-info-equivalence
hints.title: Equivalence of Geometric and Information-Theoretic Phases
hints.content:
2088: :label: thm-geometric-info-equivalence
2089: 
2090: For the Fragile Gas with emergent metric $g_{ab} = H_{ab} + \varepsilon I_{ab}$, the following are equivalent (up to $O(1/N)$ corrections):
2091: 
2092: 1. **Geometric contraction**: $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu > 0$ (exploitation phase)
2093: 2. **Information-theoretic contraction**: $\frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \mu_*) < 0$ (converging to QSD)
2094: 
2095: Furthermore, the rate of KL divergence decrease is proportional to the average Ricci curvature:
2096: 
2097: $$
2098: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \mu_*) \approx -\langle R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu \rangle + O(\sigma^2, \omega^2)
2099: $$
hints.section: ## Section 4: Physical Interpretation and Phase Transitions
hints.raw_directive:
2085: **Question**: How does the geometric phase classification (Definition {prf:ref}`def-geometric-phases`) relate to the information-theoretic classification?
2086: 
2087: :::{prf:theorem} Equivalence of Geometric and Information-Theoretic Phases
2088: :label: thm-geometric-info-equivalence
2089: 
2090: For the Fragile Gas with emergent metric $g_{ab} = H_{ab} + \varepsilon I_{ab}$, the following are equivalent (up to $O(1/N)$ corrections):
2091: 
2092: 1. **Geometric contraction**: $R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu > 0$ (exploitation phase)
2093: 2. **Information-theoretic contraction**: $\frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \mu_*) < 0$ (converging to QSD)
2094: 
2095: Furthermore, the rate of KL divergence decrease is proportional to the average Ricci curvature:
2096: 
2097: $$
2098: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \mu_*) \approx -\langle R_{\mu\nu}u^\mu u^\nu \rangle + O(\sigma^2, \omega^2)
2099: $$
